medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient symptoms included intense abdominal pain, convulsive crisis, and various urinary porphobilinogen (PBG) levels indicating acute porphyric crisis. Treatment with cimetidine led to symptom improvement over 48 to 72 hours, with follow-up over several years showing reduced urinary porphyrin levels and minimal subsequent episodes of pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1: No prior relevant conditions specified other than abdominal pain and convulsive crisis. Patient 2: History of four exploratory laparotomies. Patient 3: History of flaccid quadriparesis and high blood pressure. Patient 4: Family history of acute intermittent porphyria.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of acute intermittent porphyria in Patient 4.
